article.headline: Old Dominion 54, George Mason 53
article.story: NORFOLK, Va. (AP) -- Drew Williamson hit a buzzer-beating 3-pointer from 25 feet on Wednesday night to lead Old Dominion to a 54-53 win over George Mason. The game was tied at 49 with 5:26 left in the second half, before Williamson and George Mason's Jai Lewis each tried to lift their teams to victory. Williamson's game-winner went through with less than one second left on the clock. Alex Loughton led the Monarchs (6-1, 1-0 Colonial Athletic Association) with 14 points and nine rebounds. Isaiah Hunter had 11 for Old Dominion, and Williamson added 10. The Patriots (4-3, 1-1) were led by Lewis with 15 points, and Tony Skinn had 13. Loughton brought Old Dominion to within three after a pair of free throws with 28 seconds remaining in the half. The Patriots led 30-27 at the half. George Mason held the Monarchs to 32.2 shooting, while the Patriots shot 49 percent.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
